revised_title: Investigating the Length of the Seconds' Pendulum at the Royal Observatory
tldr: Captain Edward Sabine conducted experiments at the Royal Observatory to determine the length of the seconds' pendulum and its changes due to temperature. He found that the vibrations of Captain Kater's pendulum at 57° were 86,069.1, and at 62°, they were 86,066.9. The length of the seconds' pendulum in a vacuum would be 39.13734 inches at 62°.
